for personnel management and administration, for example to consider how an employee's health affects his/her ability to do his/her job and, if the employee is disabled, whether any reasonable adjustment should be made in order to assist him/her at work; and for the administration of insurance, pension, sick pay, and any other related benefits in force from time to time.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Biometric images though Working for Remote Safely Solution only for employees being involved in “Extended home office ODC”\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". “Extended home office ODC” is a specific setup of working place applicable when the employee performs activities physically outside of EPAM’s premises with enabled additional confidential requirements from clients because the employee manages very sensitive and secret data. Therefore, taking into account the specific nature of these clients and the special content of the data, additional IT measures must be established based on direct client’s requirements or based on analysis of security risks related to working outside EPAM premises mode. “Remote Safely solution of physical working place” verifies the identity of the employee and monitors his/her workplace surroundings during access to sensitive data. To this end, the employee, when working for these specific clients managing the very sensitive data must be alone and isolated in a closed space where no one should enter while the employee is carrying out such duties. EPAM will provide prior notice to those  employee involved in these specific clients and the sensitive data about these working conditions, and the employee must confirm his/her acceptance in writing assuming the commitment to work for the client on these matters in an isolated space, if they wish to work physically outside of EPAM’s premises.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]}]}}"
